caption: Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer was the niece of billionaire George Soros

result.explanation: The image shows Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer.  The caption's claim about her being George Soros' niece is not visually verifiable from the image.

candidates.title: Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer is not George Soros niece
candidates.content:
CLAIM: Gretchen Whitmer, the Democratic governor of Michigan, is the niece of billionaire investor and philanthropist George Soros.
APS ASSESSMENT: False. A look at the lineages of Whitmer and Soros shows he is not her uncle. Chelsea Lewis, deputy press secretary for Whitmers office, told The Associated Press this claim is absolutely false.
THE FACTS: An old conspiracy theory claiming a familial connection between Soros and Whitmer circlated anew over the weekend, with one false tweet racking up more than 700 retweets.
How many of you are aware that the female governor of Michigan is the niece of George Soros? the post read.
But this claim, which has been debunked by several fact-checking websites, is not true.
There is no relation, said Chelsea Lewis, deputy press secretary for the governor. This is absolutely false.
A look at the family lineages of each of these public figures provides further confirmation.
George Soros only brother, Paul Soros, died in 2013. According to obituaries published at the time of his death, Paul Soros had just two surviving children, Peter and Jeffrey. His two other children, Linda and Steven, both died as young children, according to The New York Times.
Wedding announcements published in The New York Times show Jeffrey Soros married Catherine Cosover in 1995 and Peter Soros married Flora Fraser in 1997.
Since George Soros has only two surviving nephews, Peter and Jeffrey, and neither married Gretchen Whitmer, its not possible Whitmer is George Soros niece.
On Whitmers side, she is the daughter of the late Sharon Whitmer, a former lawyer, and Richard Whitmer, also a lawyer and the former head of the health insurance association Blue Cross Blue Shield of Michigan.
Whitmer is married to Marc Mallory, a Michigan dentist. She was formerly married to Gary Shrewsbury.
False claims have been shared widely on social media about both Soros and Whitmer amid the coronavirus pandemic and the Black Lives Matter movement.
Whitmer, criticized for her strict stay-at-home measures during the COVID-19 pandemic, has been falsely accused of hypocrisy in following those orders.
Soros, the wealthy Democratic donor who has long been a target of bizarre conspiracy theories, has been attacked recently with a bevy of false claims, including that he paid people to protest after the death of George Floyd.
__
This is part of The Associated Press ongoing effort to fact-check misinformation that is shared widely online, including work with Facebook to identify and reduce the circulation of false stories on the platform.
Heres more information on Facebooks fact-checking program: https://www.facebook.com/help/1952307158131536
candidates.description: An old conspiracy theory claiming a familial connection between Soros and Whitmer circlated anew over the weekend, with one false tweet racking up more than 700 retweets.

result.explanation: The news caption is explicitly contradicted by Source 1.  The source directly states that the claim of Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer being George Soros' niece is false.  The fact-check provides evidence showing no familial link and quotes official statements denying the relationship.
result.supporting_points: Source 1: Title: Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer is not George Soros’ niece; Content: CLAIM: Gretchen Whitmer, the Democratic governor of Michigan, is the niece of billionaire investor and philanthropist George Soros. AP’S ASSESSMENT: False.

final_result.explanation: The claim that Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer is the niece of George Soros is demonstrably false, according to both internal and external evidence.  The image itself provides no information about the Governor's family relationships; it simply depicts her at a podium.  Therefore, the internal check correctly identifies that the claim is not visually verifiable. The external check reinforces this conclusion by citing a fact-check that explicitly debunks this claim, offering evidence such as official statements denying any familial connection.  There's a perfect alignment between the internal analysis (which notes the image's inability to verify the relationship) and the external verification (which confirms the falsehood of the claim through reliable sources). This strong agreement across methods leads to high confidence in the conclusion that the caption is out of context and factually incorrect.
final_result.validation_summary: Both internal and external validation methods strongly indicate that the caption is out of context. The image provides no relevant familial information, and external fact-checks confirm the falsehood of the claim.
